sen.j: 高野 保春（たかの やすはる、慶安3年3月3日 (旧暦)（1650年4月3日） - 正徳 (日本)2年5月26日 (旧暦)（1712年6月29日））は、江戸時代前期の公卿。
sen.e: Yasuharu TAKANO (April 3, 1650 - June 29, 1712) was a noble who lived in the early Edo Period.
Yasuharu TAKANO (April 3, 1650 - June 29, 1712) was a noble who lived in the early Edo Period.
Yasuharu TAKANO (April 3, 1650 - June 29, 1712) was a noble who lived in the early Edo period.

sen.j: 主に霊元天皇・東山天皇の御世の朝廷に仕えた。
sen.e: He served in the Imperial Court in the era of the Emperor Reigen and Emperor Higashiyama.
He served in the Imperial Court in the era of the Emperor Reigen and Emperor Higashiyama.
He served in the Imperial Court in the era of the Emperor Reigen and Emperor Higashiyama.

sen.j: 持明院基定（権大納言）の三男。
sen.e: He was the third son of Motosada JIMYOIN (Gon Dainagon).
He was the third son of Motosada JIMYOIN (Gon Dainagon).
He was the third son of Motosada JIMYOIN (Gon Dainagon, a provisional chief councilor of state).

sen.j: 母は持明院基久（中将）の娘。
sen.e: His mother was a daughter of Motohisa JIMYOIN (Chujo (lieutenant general)).
His mother was a daughter of Motohisa JIMYOIN (Chujo (lieutenant general)).
His mother was a daughter of Motohisa JIMYOIN (Chujo (lieutenant general)).

sen.j: 高野家の祖にあたる。
sen.e: He was the founder of the Takano family.
He was the founder of the Takano family.
He was the founder of the Takano family.

sen.j: また浅野内匠頭が元禄14年（1701年）に接待役を命じられていた勅使の一人としても知られる（もう一人は柳原資廉）。
sen.e: He is known as one of imperial messengers of whom Takuminokami ASANO was in charge of entertainment in 1701 (Another imperial messenger was Sukekado YANAGIWARA.
He is known as one of the imperial messengers of whom Takuminokami ASANO was in charge of entertaining in 1701 (Another imperial messenger was Sukekado YANAGIWARA.
He is known as one of the imperial messengers of whom Takuminokami ASANO was in charge of entertaining in 1701 (Another imperial messenger was Sukekado YANAGIWARA).

sen.j: 経歴
sen.e: Career
Career
Career

sen.e: March 3, 1650 (One year old): He was born.

sen.j: 万治1年（1658年） 9月10日 （9歳） ：従五位下
sen.e: September 10, 1658 (Nine years old): Given the rank of Jugoinoge (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade)

October 6, 1658 (Nine years old): Given the rank of Jugoinoge (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade).

sen.j: 寛文1年（1661年）12月 6日 （12歳）：元服のうえ昇殿、修理権大夫
sen.e: December 6, 1661 (Twelve years old): After having genpuku (ceremony of attaining manhood), admitted to the court.
December 6, 1661 (Twelve years old): After having genpuku (ceremony of attaining manhood), admitted to the court.

sen.e: May 5, 1662 (Thirteen years old): Given the rank of Jugoinojo (Junior Fifth Rank, Upper Grade)

sen.j: 元禄13年（1700年） 8月29日 （51歳）：権中納言・勅授帯剣聴直衣
sen.e: August 29, 1700 (Forty-nine years old): Assumed the position of Gon Chunagon (Provisional Middle Councilor); 授帯剣聴直衣=>chokujutaikenchonaoshi[定訳不明]
August 29, 1700 (Forty-nine years old): Assumed the position of Gon Chunagon (Provisional Middle Councilor); 授帯剣聴直衣=>chokujutaikenchonaoshi[定訳不明]
October 11, 1700 (Fifty-one years old): Assumed the position of Gon Chunagon (a provisional vice-councilor of state); chokujutaikenchonaoshi (授帯剣聴直衣).
sen.cmt: 旧暦→グレゴリオ暦に修正、Forty-nine years old→Fifty-one years oldに修正、Gon Chunagon→統一表記に修正、定訳不明のため、chokujutaikenchonaoshi (授帯剣聴直衣)としました。
